name: $::type
desc: Returns: A type of resource exposed via the restful interface.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A type of resource exposed via the restful interface.

name: $profile
desc: Returns: A specification of the profile that describes the solution's overall support for the resource, including any constraints on cardinality, bindings, lengths or other limitations. See further discussion in [Using Profiles](profiling.html#profile-uses).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A specification of the profile that describes the solution's overall support for the resource, including any constraints on cardinality, bindings, lengths or other limitations. See further discussion in [Using Profiles](profiling.html#profile-uses).

name: $supportedProfile
desc: Returns: A list of profiles that represent different use cases supported by the system. For a server, "supported by the system" means the system hosts/produces a set of resources that are conformant to a particular profile, and allows clients that use its services to search using this profile and to find appropriate data. For a client, it means the system will search by this profile and process data according to the guidance implicit in the profile. See further discussion in [Using Profiles](profiling.html#profile-uses).

name: $addsupportedProfile
desc: A list of profiles that represent different use cases supported by the system. For a server, "supported by the system" means the system hosts/produces a set of resources that are conformant to a particular profile, and allows clients that use its services to search using this profile and to find appropriate data. For a client, it means the system will search by this profile and process data according to the guidance implicit in the profile. See further discussion in [Using Profiles](profiling.html#profile-uses).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A list of profiles that represent different use cases supported by the system. For a server, "supported by the system" means the system hosts/produces a set of resources that are conformant to a particular profile, and allows clients that use its services

name: $documentation
desc: Returns: Additional information about the resource type used by the system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Additional information about the resource type used by the system.

name: $interaction
desc: Returns: Identifies a restful operation supported by the solution.

name: $addinteraction
desc: Identifies a restful operation supported by the solution.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Identifies a restful operation supported by the solution.

name: $versioning
desc: Returns: This field is set to no-version to specify that the system does not support (server) or use (client) versioning for this resource type. If this has some other value, the server must at least correctly track and populate the versionId meta-property on resources. If the value is 'versioned-update', then the server supports all the versioning features, including using e-tags for version integrity in the API.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: This field is set to no-version to specify that the system does not support (server) or use (client) versioning for this resource type. If this has some other value, the server must at least correctly track and populate the versionId meta-property on reso

name: $readHistory
desc: Returns: A flag for whether the server is able to return past versions as part of the vRead operation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A flag for whether the server is able to return past versions as part of the vRead operation.

name: $updateCreate
desc: Returns: A flag to indicate that the server allows or needs to allow the client to create new identities on the server (that is, the client PUTs to a location where there is no existing resource). Allowing this operation means that the server allows the client to create new identities on the server.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A flag to indicate that the server allows or needs to allow the client to create new identities on the server (that is, the client PUTs to a location where there is no existing resource). Allowing this operation means that the server allows the client to

name: $conditionalCreate
desc: Returns: A flag that indicates that the server supports conditional create.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A flag that indicates that the server supports conditional create.

name: $conditionalRead
desc: Returns: A code that indicates how the server supports conditional read.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A code that indicates how the server supports conditional read.

name: $conditionalUpdate
desc: Returns: A flag that indicates that the server supports conditional update.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A flag that indicates that the server supports conditional update.

name: $conditionalDelete
desc: Returns: A code that indicates how the server supports conditional delete.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A code that indicates how the server supports conditional delete.

name: $referencePolicy
desc: Returns: A set of flags that defines how references are supported.

name: $addreferencePolicy
desc: A set of flags that defines how references are supported.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A set of flags that defines how references are supported.

name: $searchInclude
desc: Returns: A list of _include values supported by the server.

name: $addsearchInclude
desc: A list of _include values supported by the server.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A list of _include values supported by the server.

name: $searchRevInclude
desc: Returns: A list of _revinclude (reverse include) values supported by the server.

name: $addsearchRevInclude
desc: A list of _revinclude (reverse include) values supported by the server.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A list of _revinclude (reverse include) values supported by the server.

name: $searchParam
desc: Returns: Search parameters for implementations to support and/or make use of - either references to ones defined in the specification, or additional ones defined for/by the implementation.

name: $addsearchParam
desc: Search parameters for implementations to support and/or make use of - either references to ones defined in the specification, or additional ones defined for/by the implementation.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Search parameters for implementations to support and/or make use of - either references to ones defined in the specification, or additional ones defined for/by the implementation.

name: $operation
desc: Returns: Definition of an operation or a named query together with its parameters and their meaning and type. Consult the definition of the operation for details about how to invoke the operation, and the parameters.

name: $addoperation
desc: Definition of an operation or a named query together with its parameters and their meaning and type. Consult the definition of the operation for details about how to invoke the operation, and the parameters.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Definition of an operation or a named query together with its parameters and their meaning and type. Consult the definition of the operation for details about how to invoke the operation, and the parameters.
